intro: Licania parviflora f. longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered licania, is a botanical variant of the species Licania parviflora. It is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its lanceolate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its inflorescences are elongated, giving it the common name "long-flowered." The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
